Detailed Description

The section has a list of all the exported API which the applications need to invoke in order to use the driver.

Function Documentation

int32_t DPM_deinit ( DPM_Handle  handle)

Description
The function is used to deinitialize and shutdown the processing chain

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the DPM Module
Return values
Success- 0
Error- one of DPM Error Codes
int32_t DPM_execute ( DPM_Handle  handle,
DPM_Buffer *  ptrResult 
)

Description
The function executes the DPM Module. Execution of the DPM module involves the following:-

  • Handling of the reception of the IPC Messages exchanged between the DPM Peers.
  • Execution & processing of the input data which has either been injected or received via the chirp available.
Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the DPM Module
[out]ptrResultPointer to the result populated by the loaded processing chain.
Return values
Success- 0
Error- one of DPM Error Codes
DPM_Handle DPM_init ( DPM_InitCfg *  ptrInitCfg,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to initialize the data path manager and initialize and load the processing chain.

Parameters
[in]ptrInitCfgPointer to the initialization configuration
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- Handle to the DPM Module
Error- NULL
int32_t DPM_ioctl ( DPM_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  cmd,
void *  arg,
uint32_t  argLen 
)

Description
The function is used to configure the processing chain.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the DPM Module
[in]cmdProfile specific command
[in]argArgument which is command specific
[in]argLenLength of the arguments which is also command specific
Return values
Success- 0
Error- one of DPM Error Codes
int32_t DPM_notifyExecute ( DPM_Handle  handle,
DPM_DPCHandle  dpcHandle,
bool  isrContext 
)

Description
The function is available to processing chain developers to notify the DPM module that the processing chain is ready to be executed. This function needs to be invoked by the DPC which in turn will allow the DPM framework to invoke the profile registered execute method.

Note: DPC developers should be aware that DPM will issue DPC provided execute only once even if multiple notifications have been issued by the DPC prior to or while DPC's execute is going on. In other words, DPM does not track multiple outstanding notifications, they are all treated as a single notification. So DPC will need to maintain its own execution status to handle multiple notifications in a single execute method.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the DPM Module
[in]dpcHandleProcessing Chain handle
[in]isrContextSet the flag to be true if the function is being invoked from ISR context else set the flag to be false
Return values
Success- 0
Error- one of DPM Error Codes
int32_t DPM_relayResult ( DPM_Handle  handle,
DPM_DPCHandle  dpcHandle,
DPM_Buffer *  ptrResult 
)

Description
The function is used to relay the partial processing chain results from one domain to another.

This is applicable only for processing chain developers while operating in the Distributed domain mode.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the DPM Module
[in]dpcHandleProcessing Chain handle
[in]ptrResultProfile results which are to be sent
Return values
Success- 0
Error- one of DPM Error Codes
int32_t DPM_sendResult ( DPM_Handle  handle,
bool  isAckNeeded,
DPM_Buffer *  ptrResult 
)

Description
The function is used to send the processing chain results to the remote DPM entities. This function is only applicable for remote & distributed domains.

The flag "isAckNeeded" can be set and this would cause the DPM framework to send to a report once the peer domain has been notified about the result availablity. This is useful and can be used to ensure that the result buffer is not being reused

DPM_Report_NOTIFY_DPC_RESULT_ACKED

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the DPM Module
[in]isAckNeededFlag which indicates if an acknowledgment is needed after the results have been passed to the remote DPM entities.
[in]ptrResultProfile results which are to be sent
Return values
Success- 0
Error- one of DPM Error Codes
int32_t DPM_start ( DPM_Handle  handle)

Description
The function is used to start the processing chain

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the DPM Module
Return values
Success- 0
Error- one of DPM Error Codes
int32_t DPM_stop ( DPM_Handle  handle)

Description
The function is used to stop the processing chain.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the DPM Module
Return values
Success- 0
Error- one of DPM Error Codes
int32_t DPM_synch ( DPM_Handle  handle,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to synchronize the execution of the framework between the DPM domains. This is an [optional] step and provides a method of synchronization if the DPM is executing on different domains.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the DPM
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Synchronized- 1
Unsynchronized- 0
Error- <0
